meanings.definition: A small, rounded mass of tissue or cells
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the lenticule under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The lenticule of cells was carefully studied in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The lenticule of tissue seemed to be waving hello under the lens.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts formed a lenticule of memories, each one distinct and colorful.
meanings.sent5: The lenticule of cells looked like a tiny universe, teeming with life.

meanings.definition: A small, disc-shaped piece of material
meanings.sent1: He found a lenticule of metal on the workshop floor.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a lenticule of glass to create a beautiful sculpture.
meanings.sent3: The lenticule of plastic rolled across the table, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a lenticule of sunshine, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The lenticule of wood gleamed in the sunlight, polished to perfection.

meanings.definition: A small, rounded body or lens
meanings.sent1: The camera lens had a tiny lenticule that helped focus the image.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the lenticule of the eye to understand vision better.
meanings.sent3: The lenticule of the telescope revealed distant stars in sharp detail.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled like a lenticule, full of curiosity and wonder.
meanings.sent5: The lenticule of the magnifying glass made the text appear larger and clearer.
